text: Drepanostachyum is an Asian genus of medium-sized mountain clumping bamboos in the grass family.Keng, Pai Chieh. 1983. Journal of Bamboo Research 2(1): 15 They are native to China, Indochina, and the Indian Subcontinent.Flora of China Vol. 22 Page 97 镰序竹属 lian xu zhu shu Drepanostachyum P. C. Keng, J. Bamboo Res. 2(1): 15. 1983. ==Taxonomy== The differences between this genus and Himalayacalamus are subtle: Drepanostachyum species have many equal branches while those of Himalayacalamus have one dominant branch. ;SpeciesKew World Checklist of Selected Plant FamiliesThe Plant List search for Drepanostachyum ;Formerly included several species now considered better suited to other genera: Ampelocalamus Dendrocalamus Fargesia Himalayacalamus ==References== Category:Bambusoideae genera Category:Flora of Asia Category:Bambusoideae
